title: How to Make a Mint and Raspberry Milkshake

steps.headline: Fill the blender with milk to the first line.
steps.description: Use whole milk, as it creates a thicker ice cream. Skimmed and semi-skimmed are fine, but they won't give the perfect texture. This should make 2-3 glasses, if you require more add more milk.

steps.headline: Add three scoops of vanilla ice cream.
steps.description: Add an extra scoop for every extra glass.

steps.headline: At this stage you can add fresh fruit such as:
steps.description: Strawberries Raspberries (these taste the best as they compliment the raspberry sauce) Blueberries

steps.headline: Add 1-2 Flake bars.
steps.description: Make sure they are broken up into smaller pieces, but not completely crushed (this will cause a mess).

steps.headline: Add the mint ice cream sauce of mint to the blender.
Put the lid securely on the blender.
steps.description: Start the blender on the first speed setting and hold for 10 seconds. Sop blending and wait for 10 seconds.

steps.headline: Repeat this process until all the ingredients are thoroughly blended and mixed.
Get several glasses to pour the milkshake into.
steps.description: Trickle the raspberry sauce all around the inside edge of the glass, for taste and decoration purposes. You will want to use a fair amount of sauce so that there is a puddle at the bottom of the glass.

steps.headline: Pour in the milkshake.
steps.description: The raspberry sauce should still stick to the outside. Gently stir the milkshake.

steps.headline: Place some mint leaves on top of the milkshake.

text: Mixing the Ingredients Fill the blender with milk to the first line. Use whole milk, as it creates a thicker ice cream. Skimmed and semi-skimmed are fine, but they won't give the perfect texture. This should make 2-3 glasses, if you require more add more milk. Add three scoops of vanilla ice cream. Add an extra scoop for every extra glass. At this stage you can add fresh fruit such as: Strawberries Raspberries (these taste the best as they compliment the raspberry sauce) Blueberries Add 1-2 Flake bars. Make sure they are broken up into smaller pieces, but not completely crushed (this will cause a mess). Add the mint ice cream sauce of mint to the blender.  Put the lid securely on the blender. Start the blender on the first speed setting and hold for 10 seconds. Sop blending and wait for 10 seconds. Repeat this process until all the ingredients are thoroughly blended and mixed.  Serving Your Milkshake Get several glasses to pour the milkshake into. Trickle the raspberry sauce all around the inside edge of the glass, for taste and decoration purposes. You will want to use a fair amount of sauce so that there is a puddle at the bottom of the glass. Pour in the milkshake. The raspberry sauce should still stick to the outside. Gently stir the milkshake. Place some mint leaves on top of the milkshake. Get a straw and enjoy.
